Title.evidence: Evaluation of the ARISCAT Score for Predicting Postoperative Pneumonia in ESCC: A Retrospective Cohort Study

Trial_Design.evidence: This retrospective cohort study included 366 patients

Participants.evidence: 366 patients with histologically confirmed resectable ESCC who underwent curative thoraco-laparoscopic McKeown esophagectomy at a high-volume thoracic surgery center

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the prognostic value of the ARISCAT score and its integration with other perioperative indicators for predicting postoperative pneumonia.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Postoperative pneumonia was diagnosed based on radiologic, clinical, and laboratory criteria within 30 days after surgery.

Result_Outcome.evidence: In multivariate analysis, the ARISCAT score was independently associated with postoperative pneumonia (adjusted OR = 1.40, 95% CI 1.22–1.60, p < 0.001).
